column4: In gnome, what's the best windows manager to look glassy like vista?
its not the window manager that looks that way.. but compiz + the emerald window decorator can look a lot like vista.
you might have to make your own emerald theme, or find one to download.
compiz can use one of several 'window decorators' a GTK/gnome based one, a KDE/qt based one, or Emerald..
each has its own 'look'
if you want somthing that can look like XP/Vista/Windows  glassy stuff -> emerald can
then you are not going to get a very Glassy Looking theme.
once i switched to DVI the picture was so much better.. i NEVER want to use vga again
ive told dozens of people at work.. if you can use DVI then USE dvi..
ICK. i would definatly use dvi if the sytem supports it
the tool 'ubuntu-tweak' lets you use one or the other/installed it easially
yes
and costs more $$$

the tools i use int he past dont support ext4. ive not tried them lately
